summary:
• Asset Sale Completion: Pursuit Minerals has completed the sale of its Commando and Warrior Projects (Kalgoorlie and Calingiri, WA) for $300,000 total consideration ($20,000 refundable deposit + $280,000 settlement cash payment).
  • Counterparty: Sold to Kurnalpi Gold Pty Ltd, a private gold project developer.
  • Material Impact: Divestment removes associated tenement obligations and provides liquidity (~$280k net proceeds).

Omitted non-material details (e.g., subsidiary name, contact info, boilerplate).

Summary of ASX Announcement for Enova Mining Ltd (ENV):

  • Exploration Update:
  • Drilling Completed: 6 auger holes (121m total) at CODA Central, targeting titanium-REE mineralisation in ferruginous kamafugite saprolite.
  • Assay Pending: 107 samples submitted to SGS Lab; results expected late July 2025.

  • Metallurgical Testing: 270kg composite sample undergoing magnetic separation and mineral characterisation (Brisbane/Belo Horizonte labs).

  • Next Steps:

  • Continued drilling and assay interpretation to define high-priority REE zones.

  • Tenement transfer (from RBM Consultoria to Enova) with ANM approval pending.

  • Material Catalyst: Assay results (due late July) could significantly impact valuation if confirming high-grade REE/Ti mineralisation.

No capital raising, financials, or trading halt details identified.

No material information identified.

(Note: A change of company secretary is a routine disclosure with no direct impact on trading, valuation, or capital structure.)

Here's the extracted material information from the ASX announcement (DFS Presentation) in concise bullet points:

DFS Highlights:
- Production Profile: ~250kozpa average gold production over 12.2 years.
- Reserves/Resources: 2.95Moz Ore Reserve (51.6Mt @ 1.78 g/t); 5.53Moz Mineral Resource (103.6Mt @ 1.66 g/t).
- Economics (post-tax, base case US$2,400/oz Au):
- NPV5%: US$1.6bn; IRR: 46%; Payback: 1.9 years.
- Spot case (US$3,300/oz Au): NPV5% US$2.9bn, IRR 73%.
- Costs:
- LOM AISC: US$1,057/oz (C1 cash costs: US$841/oz).
- Pre-production capex: US$463m.

Project Status:
- Key Approvals: Environmental Compliance Certificate secured (Jan 2025); Exploitation Permit application in final stage.
- Project Timeline: Final Investment Decision targeted for early 2026; first production by Q2 2028.

Sensitivities:
- Each US$100/oz gold price increase adds ~US$140m NPV5%.

Exploration Upside:
- Significant potential to extend mine life via near-resource and regional targets (e.g., Argo/Bokoro permits, though subject to appeal after May 2025 revocation notices).

Risks:
- DFS includes 9.6% Inferred Resources (307koz); geological confidence lower for these portions.

Other:
- Guinea jurisdiction: Stable mining code, 5% royalty + 1% local development levy, 30% corporate tax.

Omitted: Operational details, community programs, historical exploration results, and non-material project descriptions.

Conclusion: DFS confirms robust economics and tier-1 scale, with high leverage to gold prices. Major catalysts are permitting and financing progress.

Exploration Update Summary (Trek Metals Limited - TKM):

  • Additional drill rig secured: DDH1 diamond rig to arrive early July for deeper exploration at Christmas Creek Gold Project.
  • Ongoing RC drilling results: Targeting extensions of high-grade intervals (e.g., 10m @ 12.66g/t Au from 59m).
  • Assay timing: Initial RC results expected mid-to-late July 2025.
  • Heritage clearance: Surveying completed, enabling testing of additional targets.

No material trading or capital markets impact identified (operational update only).

• Substantial Holder Change: Van Eck Associates Corporation reduced its voting power in West African Resources Ltd from 7.77% (88,548,494 shares) to 6.36% (72,499,929 shares) as of 20 June 2025.
  • Key Transaction Details: Net reduction of ~16 million shares via in-kind disposals across multiple ETFs (e.g., GDX, GDXJ) between January–June 2025.

Note: No material capital structure or liquidity impact beyond the disclosed shareholding change.

• Unlisted Options Exercise: 65,068 ordinary shares issued at $0.00 exercise price (options expiring 30 June 2026).
  • Regulatory Disclosure: Cleansing notice issued under Corporations Act 708A(5)(e), confirming no undisclosed material information.

No material impact on capital structure or liquidity (nil-cost exercise).

Strategic Funding Update (Eclipse Metals Ltd - ASX: EPM)
- Funding Discussions: Multiple non-binding strategic funding discussions underway with global institutional and government-related entities.
- Key Asset Attributes:
- Grønnedal Project: 89Mt Inferred Resource @ 6,363ppm TREO, high Nd+Pr (29% of TREO), polymetallic potential (niobium, HREEs).
- Ivigtût Project: Early-stage revenue potential from historic mine waste (silver, zinc, gallium, copper).
- Metallurgical Advantage: Up to 54% liberation of key minerals, enabling low-energy flotation.
- Explansion Plans: Resource drilling scheduled Q3 2025.
- Geopolitical Edge: Greenland location offers deep-water access, low sovereign risk, and alignment with Western critical mineral strategies.

Material Catalyst: Potential non-dilutive funding partnerships could accelerate project development.

Note: No capital raising, trading halt, or financial metrics disclosed.

• CEO Appointment: Carmen Riley appointed as CEO/Executive Director effective 1 July 2025.
  • Transition Plan: Current CEO David Collins remains as Managing Director until 30 June 2026 to support transition and M&A pipeline.
  • Remuneration: Carmen Riley’s total fixed remuneration is $700,000 (incl. super), with STI (up to 50% of TFR) and LTI (Performance Rights).

No material trading or capital markets impact identified.

Material Information Summary:

Exploration Results (Lithium Drilling Update):

  • Key intersections in RMDD007:
  • 95m @ 1,340ppm Li (0.72% LCE) from 54.9m (widest intersection to date).
  • 5.4m @ 2,320ppm Li (1.24% LCE) from 154m.

  • 24.3m @ 1,290ppm Li (0.68% LCE) from 180.4m.

  • Key intersections in RMDD006:

  • 31.8m @ 1,120ppm Li (0.60% LCE) from 74.7m.

  • 24.3m @ 1,040ppm Li (0.55% LCE) from 7.6m.

  • New zone identified: Rock chip sampling revealed untested lithium potential in the project’s eastern area.

  • Pending assays: Results for drill-holes RMDD004 and RMDD008 expected in July 2025.
  • Next steps: Maiden Mineral Resource Estimate targeted for late 2025.

No capital raising, trading halt, or financial data identified.

Summary of Clever Culture Systems Ltd (ASX:CC5) Updated Company Presentation (25 June 2025):

  • Operational Highlights:
  • 13 APAS® Independence instruments sold to pharmaceutical customers since March 2024 launch.
  • Engaged with 14 of the top 20 global pharmaceutical companies (by revenue).

  • 28 instruments installed globally, including enterprise customers like AstraZeneca (7 units) and Bristol Myers Squibb (2 units).

  • Product Expansion:

  • Contact plates launch (Q1 FY26) to automate majority of Environmental Monitoring tests, expanding addressable market.

  • Revenue model: Up to AUD $1.5M per instrument (40% upfront Capex, 40% ARR from software, 15% service).

  • Financial Position (31 March 2025):

  • Cash: AUD $2.2M; Receivables: AUD $3.6M.
  • Breakeven: ~11 instrument sales annually (estimated AUD $4.2M cost base).

  • HY25 maiden profit: AUD $1.1M (driven by AUD $3.8M product sales).

  • Market Opportunity:

  • TAM: AUD $2.8B for aseptic manufacturing microbiology testing.

  • Pipeline: 40+ qualified leads (~AUD $75M potential upfront sales + AUD $15M p.a. ARR).

  • Key Catalyst: Contact plate launch (Q1 FY26) to accelerate sales momentum.

No material capital markets actions (e.g., raising, halt) identified.

• Scheme of Arrangement: PointsBet Holdings Limited proposes acquisition by MIXI, Inc. via scheme of arrangement.
  • Scheme Consideration: Improved offer of $1.20 per share (from original $1.06).
  • Premium: Represents a 44.6% premium to pre-announcement closing price ($0.83) and exceeds Independent Expert’s valuation range ($0.96–$1.11).
  • Key Dates:
  • Scheme Meeting: 25 June 2025 (results to be announced post-meeting).
  • Court Approval Hearing: 26 June 2025 (final step for implementation).
  • Conditions Precedent: FIRB and NTRWC approvals secured; Ontario approvals in progress. No financing/due diligence conditions.
  • Proxy Votes (Pre-Meeting):
  • 69.47% in favour (excluding Betr’s votes: 95.68% support).
  • 29.59% against (mostly Betr Entertainment’s 66M shares).
  • Directors’ Recommendation: Unanimously in favour, citing cash certainty and regulatory risks of standalone business.
  • No Superior Proposal: Betr’s informal offers rejected as non-binding/uncompetitive.

Material details only—boilerplate and procedural content omitted.

  • Defense Sector Focus: Agreement targets testing and potential integration of Li-S batteries for military/security applications (e.g., UAVs, soldier systems).

• Material Announcement Summary:
  • Offtake Agreement: Secured maiden US order for 80 metric tonnes of expandable graphite via 50/50 JV (Panthera Graphite).
  • Revenue: ~A$400,000 expected from the shipment (delivery over next 2 months).
  • Strategic Significance: Strengthens position as non-Chinese critical mineral supplier; supports US supply chain diversification.
  • Market Context: Expandable graphite demand driven by EV, energy storage, and aerospace sectors.
  • Future Outlook: Ongoing negotiations for additional supply agreements in US, Europe, and Asia.

Material Information Summary

Acquisition & Capital Raising Announcement

  • Acquisition: Xero to acquire 100% of Melio (US SMB bill pay platform) for US$2.5B (A$3.9B) upfront (cash + scrip), plus up to US$0.5B in contingent payments.
  • Funding:
  • Placement: A$1.85B (fully underwritten) at A$176/share (9.4% discount to last close).
  • SPP: Target ~A$200M, max A$30k per shareholder, priced at lower of Placement Price or 2% discount to 5-day VWAP post-close.
  • Debt: US$0.4B revolving credit facility.
  • Cash: US$0.6B from balance sheet.
  • Valuation: Melio valued at 13.4x FY25 annualized revenue (US$187M) or 9.7x including FY28 revenue synergies (US$70M).
  • Pro Forma Leverage: Net debt/EBITDA ~2.3x post-transaction.
  • Synergies: Targeted US$70M revenue + US$20M cost savings by FY28.
  • Strategic Rationale: Accelerates US growth; combined entity aims to double Xero’s FY25 group revenue by FY28.

Key Timetable

  • SPP Record Date: 24 June 2025.
  • Placement Settlement: 30 June 2025.
  • SPP Close: 21 July 2025.
  • SPP Allotment: 28 July 2025.

Conditions

  • Regulatory approvals (US antitrust, money transmitter licenses).
  • Break fee of US$37.5M if deal fails due to HSR rejection.

Omitted: Operational details, management commentary, legal disclaimers.

• Trading Halt Reason: Pending announcement of a corporate transaction and associated equity raising.
  • Halt Duration: Until the earlier of:
  • Completion of institutional component announcement or
  • Commencement of trading on 26 June 2025.
